text.citation: Rau, D. V., & Dong, M. N. (2006). Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary. Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica.
text.BibTeX_citation: @book{rau2006yami, title={Yami texts with reference grammar and dictionary}, author={Rau, D Victoria and Dong, Maa-Neu}, year={2006}, publisher={Institute of Linguistics, Academia Sinica}}
text.source: ['9. podpoden o ngepen ni Akay', '幫祖父拔牙齒', 'Helping Grandpa pull his tooth', '', 'si apen Ogaog (M, 69, Iranmilek)', '黃馬期，男，69，東清村', '']

S.FORM: mi-key-ke-ian namen si ka-kteh ito si apen Tagaan ito am.
S.TRANSL: 有一天，我和我的好兄弟si apen Tagaan待在村中裡一起作伴玩耍
One day, my brother si apen Tagaan and I were playing around.

S.FORM: ma-níring jiaken si akay icialaw, ta ingn-en na o ngepen na ma-gona-gonay,
S.TRANSL: 祖父牙齒動搖，感覺得很痛，祖父就對我說
Grandpa talked to me because his tooth was moving and it hurt.

S.FORM: ta no k-om-an am, ji máka-ka-kan, akma-an jiaken i sio a ji a-bsoy i sio.
S.TRANSL: 吃飯的時候，因為沒辦法好好的吃，就像我以前的情形一樣，因為牙痛沒辦法吃飽
He couldn’t chew when he ate. Just like me before, he was never full.

S.FORM: i-ka-ráhet na do ka-langa-langay na am,
S.TRANSL: （吃飯的時候）臉部時常要往上仰，令他感到困擾不已
Whenever (he ate), he faced upwards, but the action made him feel bad.

S.FORM: ma-níring jiaken am, yamen si apen Tagaan ito,
S.TRANSL: 當時只有si apen Tagaan和我在場，祖父對我說，
At the time only si apen Tagaan and I were there, and Grandpa told me,

S.FORM: “mo Sazovaz,” koan na yaken, “ikongo?”
S.TRANSL: 他說“Sazovaz！” 我說“什麼事？”
“Sazovaz!” “Yes, Grandpa?” I said.

S.FORM: “a ma-kteb ko, ji mo nge-ngn-an?”
S.TRANSL: “我哪有辦法弄斷你的牙齒？而且你會痛啊”
“How can I break your tooth? It will hurt!”

S.FORM: “ciaha, ta ya ji a-tey-láhet manga apo ko a”, “nohon”.
S.TRANSL: “沒關係，受夠了” ，“好吧”
“It’s okay, I can’t bear it any longer.” “Okay.”

S.FORM: ni-ma-kteb a ke-kezdas am ori o ni-ha-hap ko ori a, ka-pangap ko so pa-patok
S.TRANSL: 我撿了一支斷掉的鐮刀，還有一個鎚子
I picked up a broken sickle and a hammer.

S.FORM: ratateng am, “ori o ya om-lang-langay, mo apo ko”
S.TRANSL: “孫子，你看會往上動搖的那個就是了”
“Grandson, the one that is shaking upwards is the one.”

S.FORM: pa-angn-an ko so mao ori a, “key!” to ko patok-a ori am, “nga! mo ka-zisaw, ayayay, ayayaya..”.
S.TRANSL: 我把石頭擺在（搖動的牙齒）下面。他說“快呀！” 我就鎚了一下，“喔，好痛啊，你要死啦，啊呀呀，啊呀呀呀”
I placed a stone underneath the tooth, and he said, “Quick!” I hammered, and he started screaming, “Shit! Ow, that hurts! Ahhhhhhh, Owwww!”

S.FORM: “ciana, mo Akay an?” “cítey pala, manga apo ko”
S.TRANSL: “那就算了吧，祖父” ，“等一下再試試看，孫子”
“Grandpa, let’s stop.” “Wait a while and try again, Grandson.”

S.FORM: “key! ta “nga! mo ka-zisaw, ananay”,
S.TRANSL: “快呀！來拔！” “喔，好痛啊，你要死啦，啊喲喲喲”
“Quick! Pull it out!” “Ahhh, hell! Owwww, Ahhhhhhh!”

S.FORM: “to rana koan o ya asa ya, ya me-yngen, a ya ma-kteb”.
S.TRANSL: “這一顆就這樣算了啦，你會痛，而我也打不斷它”
“Let’s stop, let’s just leave this one because it hurts and I can’t break it.”

S.FORM: “apia ya, manga apo ko, ta ya ko i-ka-niahey, ta ya ko ji maka-ka-kan, manga apo ko”.
S.TRANSL: “這怎麼辦呢，孫子? 可是我怕痛呢，它讓我沒辦法好好的吃頓飯
“What can we do, Grandson? I am so afraid of it, and I can’t eat.”

S.FORM: “a k-om-oan am, tosia an, mo Akay, ta me-yngen an”,
S.TRANSL: “可是有什麼辦法呢，算了吧，祖父，拔了你又痛”
“I can’t do anything, so let’s stop, Grandpa. (If I pull it), it will hurt.”

S.FORM: “nohon, manga apo ko a, taosia, manga apo ko” koan na no nang am,
S.TRANSL: 他說“好吧，那就算了，不要拔了，孫子”
“All right, let’s give up, Grandson” he said.

S.FORM: pan-pandan na do ka-nge-nge-ngé-ngen na no ngepen na ni akay ta icialaw am do nang am.
S.TRANSL: 那時候祖父真的牙痛的厲害
Grandpa was really going crazy about this tooth.

S.FORM: k-omo-an am, toda a-kteb? a no si ma-kteb am, ka-kcil-an saon?
S.TRANSL: 但有什麼辦法？想打斷它就會斷嗎？就算弄斷了，也是會斷得不整齊
But it wasn’t that easy. It isn’t possible to say break and have it break. Even if it did, who would know if it only broke in half?

S.FORM: ya ge-getget a, apia o ka-ngerenged na no getget-en i sio am, ori o akma sang am,
S.TRANSL: 不像鋸子鋸得很整齊
It’s not like a saw that can cut things straight.

S.FORM: o patok-en am, ji a-skil-i, am ori mina to ko á-mtaj-i nia ji akay ta icialaw ito a.
S.TRANSL: 但是用鎚子鎚斷的會是裂碎的情形；所以就只好作罷，不再拔祖父的牙齒了
Even if I did break the tooth with a hammer, it might have broken unevenly, so I might as well not help him take out the tooth.

S.FORM: “pángap so i-kteb so ngepen ko”,
S.TRANSL: “去找一個可以打斷我牙齒的工具來”
“Go find something that you can use to break my tooth.”

S.FORM: ji ko na naway, a kong-koan no ma-cingcing so ngepen,
S.TRANSL: 句意不詳
[Sentence meaning not clear

S.FORM: am ka-ji ko rana lavi-an saon a ma-rilaw nia am, ka-metdeh no akma-n sito, do ka-ji na maka-ka-kan-an nia am, ori rana saon am.
S.TRANSL: 看到祖父的情形，讓我很同情的都快要哭了，吃飯的時候像小孩子一樣，沒 辦法好好的吃飯
After seeing my grandfather’s condition, I wanted to cry with him. He was like a child who couldn’t eat.
